January 1917.SECRET.WAR CABINET, 34.Minutes of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10, Downing Street, S.W., anMonday, January 15, 1917, at 3t6 p.m.Present :The Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. the Earl Ourzon of kedleston, K.G., G.O.S.I., G-.C.I.E.The Right Hon. Viscount Milner, G.C.B.,G.C.M.G.The Right Hon. A. Henderson, M.P.The Right Hon. A, Bonar Law, M.P.In attendance :The Right Hon. A. J. Balfour, O.M., : H.E. M. Paul Cambon. French Am-M.P., Secretary of State for Foreign ambassador.Affairs. General Nivelle, Cotnmander-in-Chief of, ^ IT the French Armies of the North and field-Marshal Sir Douglas Haig, G.C.B., ' North-West.G.C.V.O., K.C.I.E., Commander-in- M. A. de Fleuriau, Councillor of Embassy.Chief of the Expeditionary Force. Colonel de la Paxouse, C.B., MilitaryGeneral Sir W. R. Robertson, K.O.B., ! . Davidson, D.S.O. j Capitaine de Suzannet.Lieut.-Colonel E. FitzG. Dillon, D.S.O. \ Capitaine Guillaume.Lieutenant-Colonel Sir M. F. A. Hankey, K.C.B., SecretaryLieutenant-Colonel E. D. Swinton, D.S.O., R.E., Assistant Secretary.M. Mantoux, Interpreter."he Western Front. THE War Cabinet discussed with General Nivelle, theCommander-in-Chief of the French Army on the Western front,and with Field-Marshal Sir Douglas Haig the extent of front to beheld respectively hy the British and French Armies, and other questions connected with the campaign of 1917.(Initialled) D. LI G.2, Whitehall Gardens, S.W.,January 16, 1917.[1365-34]
